creator: irisgottlieb
title: Etching Anodized Aluminum
description: This project outlines the process of creating delicate drawings on anodized aluminum by etching away the colored surface to reveal the bright aluminum underneath, using a laser cutter.
steps: Prepare your drawings either by hand and scanning them, or digitally using programs like CorelDraw, Illustrator, or Photoshop. Consider the effect of line thickness and shading when creating your design.

For delicate thin lines, use vector line work. In CorelDraw, import your drawing and do a centerline trace, avoiding outline traces. In Photoshop or Illustrator, use the trace function and adjust the line thickness.
For shading, use a raster image with varying shades of gray, understanding that darker grays will result in lighter etched areas.

Experiment with different laser cutter settings. For shading on an Epilogue laser cutter, use raster settings with Power 100%, Speed 25%, 400 dpi, and standard or Floyd Steinberg dithering. Adjust gas assist as needed. The total etching time is about 5 minutes per etching.
